meanings.definition: An officer of a royal or noble household, charged with the care of the horses.
meanings.sent1: The equerries ensured the horses were well-fed and groomed.
meanings.sent2: The equerries accompanied the royal family during their horseback rides.
meanings.sent3: The equerries joked about having to give the horses royal baths.
meanings.sent4: The equerries were the guardians of the noble steeds.
meanings.sent5: The equerries' dedication to the horses was unwavering.

meanings.definition: A member of the British royal household who attends or assists members of the royal family.
meanings.sent1: The equerries helped the royal family with their daily tasks.
meanings.sent2: The equerries were always by the side of the royal family.
meanings.sent3: The equerries playfully teased the royal family about their quirks.
meanings.sent4: The equerries were like loyal shadows to the royal family.
meanings.sent5: The equerries' loyalty to the royal family was unmatched.

meanings.definition: A person who rides horses competitively or for pleasure.
meanings.sent1: The equerries participated in horse riding competitions.
meanings.sent2: The equerries enjoyed leisurely rides through the countryside.
meanings.sent3: The equerries laughed as they raced each other on horseback.
meanings.sent4: The equerries were like knights on their trusty steeds.
meanings.sent5: The equerries' love for horseback riding was evident in their smiles.
